image.altText: kevin wife homecare yard

props.synopsis: Care providers are trying to strongarm cash from suppliers of equipment, including wheelchairs, a month after the federal government reformed home care packages for senior Australians.

title.children: 'It's borderline illegal': The battle raging on the home care front

image.altText: A man smiles in a photo with coworkers

props.synopsis: Detectives have issued an additional 83 charges against Joshua Dale Brown, a former childcare worker who was charged with more than 70 offences earlier this year.

title.children: Breaking: Alleged childcare paedophile Joshua Brown hit with further charges

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at press conference

props.synopsis: Despite holding a commanding position, Anthony Albanese knows the global trend of sliding trust in government isn't one to be taken lightly.

title.children: Three things show Albanese's score on trust and integrity

image.altText: A young child holds a mobile phone with a padlock graphic embossed over the top.

props.synopsis: Today marks the unofficial start of the teen social media ban. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: The teen social media ban is here. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: Illustration of a person sitting below cards and dice that are rising above him

props.synopsis: Chat logs and gambling data show the tactics used by Australian-run online casino Stake to keep one user hooked.

title.children: One player's case against the world's biggest crypto casino

image.altText: A room with a dentist chair is surrounded by masks of men on the wall

props.synopsis: Democrats say the newly released images provide a "harrowing look" into Jeffrey Epstein's world, as the late sex offender's jailed accomplice, Ghislaine Maxwell, informs a court she is planning to challenge her imprisonment.

title.children: Images of Epstein's island released as Maxwell flags bid for freedom

image.altText: An old woman and man, both wearing glasses, sit on chairs around a round wooden table

props.synopsis: The family of the late first wife of High Country killer Greg Lynn says a fresh investigation into her death has stalled because police will not pay for an expert report.

title.children: Fresh probe into Lisa Lynn's death stalls over $9,000 bill, family says

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is edging higher in early trade, while former treasurer Peter Costello is urging Australia to arrest its fertility downturn. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX edges higher as former treasurer urges Australians to have more babies

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Tobacco black market big enough for ABS ruler
ASX edges higher, but more stocks fall than rise

image.altText: Aerial shot of cars

props.synopsis: A man is charged with murder after a shooting on the coast of northern NSW that left one man dead and two others injured.

title.children: Man charged with murder over shooting on NSW North Coast

image.altText: A composite of Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Vladimir Putin.

props.synopsis: After a flurry of meetings, Russia's war in Ukraine continues. So where is the peace process at?

title.children: Here's what experts say about the Russia–Ukraine peace process

image.altText: Tony Burke makes an address.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley says the Coalition does not support the return of women who were taken to Syria as partners of Islamic State members, and says the home affairs minister needs to answer questions about why he held a meeting with Save the Children.

title.children: Coalition urges Burke to explain meeting ahead of women returning from Syria

image.altText: Pete Hegseth looking at the camera with a stern expression and furrowed brow.

props.synopsis: A report by the Pentagon watchdog concludes US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated Pentagon policy by using his personal device for official business and recommends better training for all Pentagon officials.

title.children: Hegseth's use of Signal app posed risk to US personnel, watchdog finds

image.altText: Macquarie Point render, Hurricanes game

props.synopsis: The Hobart stadium is unofficially approved after securing enough yes votes, but the $1.13 billion project is still being scrutinised in the Tasmanian parliament. Follow the debate live.

title.children: Hobart's stadium debate continues, with project unofficially approved

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Live coverage of day two of Hobart stadium debate and vote
What will the stadium look like?

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walks away as a TV camera films him.

props.synopsis: With his defamation appeal dismissed and legal costs rising, Bruce Lehrmann is almost out of options. A High Court bid is possible, but what would it take to get there?

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann is running out of courts to continue his legal battle

image.altText: A raccoon is seen passed out on a bathroom floor, in between a black bin and a white toilet.

props.synopsis: The suspect broke into a liquor store in the US state of Virginia, ransacked several shelves and ended up face down in the bathroom.

title.children: Raccoon goes on liquor binge and passes out in toilet

image.altText: Black and white image of Jimmy Barnes in a white singlet in an open space staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: Cold Chisel was over. America beckoned. And Jimmy Barnes was terrified. This is the story of the album that made him, and the song that saved him.

title.children: Jimmy Barnes's American gamble didn't pay off — but he has no regrets

image.altText: Travis Head looks over his shoulder as he completes a shot.

props.synopsis: The second Ashes Test is upon us and we have fingers crossed it will last more than two days. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: What time does the Gabba Test start and everything else you need to know

image.altText: A group of wind turbines dotted along a hillside against a hazy blue sky

props.synopsis: An energy watchdog says more renewable energy is projected to lower prices, but others warn the promise is illusory and more pain is coming.

title.children: Watchdog flags 5 per cent fall in power prices amid renewables surge

image.altText: aa middle aged man with greying hair and glasses

props.synopsis: A California doctor is imprisoned for illegally supplying Friends sitcom star Matthew Perry with ketamine, the powerful sedative that caused the actor's drug overdose death in 2023.

title.children: Doctor in Matthew Perry overdose case jailed

image.altText: A close up photo of Jaclyn Symes with a red background

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jaclyn Symes says the state's public service has become "top-heavy" with "too many executives", as her government unveils measures to save $4 billion over the next four years.

title.children: Victorian government targets executives as 1,000 public sector jobs cut

image.altText: A Shanghai arena sits deserted as Japanese cultural events face sudden cancellations.

props.synopsis: Beijing halts more than 20 Japanese cultural events across China as its diplomatic spat with Japan escalates.

title.children: Japan's pop queen sings to 14,000 empty seats amid Beijing crackdown

image.altText: A large bronze sculpture of a gorilla that has been installed in a park.

props.synopsis: A statue of a 30-year-old eastern lowland gorilla named Mina is one of 22 donated to Eurobodalla Shire Council by internationally recognised artists Gillie and Marc.

title.children: $1.6m art installation, including 3-metre gorilla, gets town talking

image.altText: Hong Kong fire

props.synopsis: Authorities are continuing to probe the blaze at the Wang Fuk Court complex, which killed at least 159 people last week.

title.children: Six people arrested for deactivating fire alarms at Hong Kong fire site

image.altText: Ursula von der Leyen at a microphone.

props.synopsis: Belgium is pushing back on a European proposal to use frozen Russian assets to help financially support Ukraine.

title.children: EU proposes using frozen Russian assets to fund Ukraine

image.altText: Two armoured vehicles with Ukrainian flags on the side.

props.synopsis: Australia will provide an additional $95 million in military assistance to Ukraine and slap a fresh round of sanctions on ships believed to be part of Moscow's so-called "shadow fleet".

title.children: Australia to provide Ukraine with $95m funding boost

image.altText: A man at a sporting press conference

props.synopsis: Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt says he is unlikely to be coaching the All Blacks at the World Cup, as Australia and New Zealand are drawn into the same group.

title.children: History made as Wallabies and All Blacks drawn into same World Cup group

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump smiling.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says his country is at war with "narco-terrorists". But he is freeing the former president of Honduras, who was jailed in the US for overseeing one of the world's worst drug conspiracies.

title.children: What led Trump to free a president jailed for flooding the US with drugs

image.altText: An image showing a man holding a phone. An image of a woman is reflected in his glasses.

props.synopsis: Confronting accounts give a rare insight into the minds of perpetrators of deepfake image-based abuse, as part of a landmark study.

title.children: 'A little bit of revenge': Offenders give insight into deepfake image abuse

image.altText: A pencil drawing of a man surrounded by a vortex of redress scheme forms

props.synopsis: An independent audit of the National Redress Scheme has found wait times are increasing and causing significant distress to survivors of child sexual abuse.

title.children: Child sexual abuse victims face anxious wait for redress via official scheme

image.altText: A sun burning bright in an orange sky above clouds on the horizon.

props.synopsis: Temperatures are set to soar in parts of Victoria today after a wintry start to the season earlier this week.

title.children: Victoria on fire alert as temperatures hit high 30s after cold start to summer

image.altText: A For Lease sign advertising a rental property in Carlton North.

props.synopsis: A new report finds that about 70 per cent of renters were avoiding heating and cooling their homes to save money. Some experts and advocates are calling for stronger minimum energy standards across the country.

title.children: Most renters avoid heating and cooling homes due to costs

image.altText: A girl holds three tennis balls of increasing size. She is smiling and wearing reflective blue and green sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Victorian teenager Maddy Kelly was 11 years old when she started losing her sight. Two years later, she's a national tennis champion.

title.children: Teen who lost sight at 11 becomes national tennis champion
